titleStmt.title: A true relation and iournall, of the manner of the arrivall, and magnificent entertainment, giuen to the high and mighty Prince Charles, Prince of Great Britaine, by the King of Spaine in his court at Madrid

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A18476 of text S107754 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 5031). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 32 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 19 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: A true relation and iournall, of the manner of the arrivall, and magnificent entertainment, giuen to the high and mighty Prince Charles, Prince of Great Britaine, by the King of Spaine in his court at Madrid
titleStmt.author: Bristol, John Digby, Earl of, 1580-1654, attributed name.
Buckingham, George Villiers, Duke of, 1592-1628, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Iohn Hauiland for William Barret,

notesStmt.note: Sometimes attributed to John Digby, Earl of Bristol, and to George Villiers, Duke of Buckingham.

Gathering A, B outer forme, and part of E inner forme are in two settings which occur in various combinations, sometimes mixed with STC 5032 (though the first readings below tend to appear in STC 5031). Title page (1) lacks the words "Published by authority", or (2) has "Published by authority" (copies with latter reading should be matched to STC 5032); A3r lines 1-2 have (1) "the #5FD\ ninth" or (2) "the se- #5FD\ uenth"; A3v line 7 has (1) "Bristowes" or (2) "Bristolls"; B2v has (1) "Equipage" or (2) "equipage"; E4r line 11 has (1) "hee had" or (2) "he had". Most of the other formes appear in two impositions.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
